59extern volatile sig_atomic_t interrupted;
60extern int showprogress;
61
62/* Minimum amount of data to read at a time */
63#define MIN_READ_SIZE 512
64
65/* Maximum depth to descend in directory trees */
66#define MAX_DIR_DEPTH 64
67
68struct sftp_conn {
69 int fd_in;
70 int fd_out;
71 u_int transfer_buflen;
72 u_int num_requests;
73 u_int version;
74 u_int msg_id;
75#define SFTP_EXT_POSIX_RENAME 0x00000001
76#define SFTP_EXT_STATVFS 0x00000002
77#define SFTP_EXT_FSTATVFS 0x00000004
78#define SFTP_EXT_HARDLINK 0x00000008
79#define SFTP_EXT_FSYNC 0x00000010
80#define SFTP_EXT_LSETSTAT 0x00000020
81 u_int exts;
82 u_int64_t limit_kbps;
83 struct bwlimit bwlimit_in, bwlimit_out;
84};
85
86static u_char *
87get_handle(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int expected_id, size_t *len,
88 const char *errfmt, ...) __attribute__((format(printf, 4, 5)));
89
90/* ARGSUSED */
91static int
92sftpio(void *_bwlimit, size_t amount)
93{
94 struct bwlimit *bwlimit = (struct bwlimit *)_bwlimit;
95
96 refresh_progress_meter(0);
97 if (bwlimit != NULL)
98 bandwidth_limit(bwlimit, amount);
99 return 0;
100}
101
102static void
103send_msg(struct sftp_conn *conn, struct sshbuf *m)
104{
105 u_char mlen[4];
106 struct iovec iov[2];
107
108 if (sshbuf_len(m) > SFTP_MAX_MSG_LENGTH)
109 fatal("Outbound message too long %zu", sshbuf_len(m));
110
111 /* Send length first */
112 put_u32(mlen, sshbuf_len(m));
113 iov[0].iov_base = mlen;
114 iov[0].iov_len = sizeof(mlen);
115 iov[1].iov_base = __UNCONST(sshbuf_ptr(m));
116 iov[1].iov_len = sshbuf_len(m);
117
118 if (atomiciov6(writev, conn->fd_out, iov, 2, sftpio,
119 conn->limit_kbps > 0 ? &conn->bwlimit_out : NULL) !=
120 sshbuf_len(m) + sizeof(mlen))
121 fatal("Couldn't send packet: %s", strerror(errno));
122
123 sshbuf_reset(m);
124}
125
126static void
127get_msg_extended(struct sftp_conn *conn, struct sshbuf *m, int initial)
128{
129 u_int msg_len;
130 u_char *p;
131 int r;
132
133 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(m, 4, &p)) != 0)
134 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
135 if (atomicio6(read, conn->fd_in, p, 4, sftpio,
136 conn->limit_kbps > 0 ? &conn->bwlimit_in : NULL) != 4) {
137 if (errno == EPIPE || errno == ECONNRESET)
138 fatal("Connection closed");
139 else
140 fatal("Couldn't read packet: %s", strerror(errno));
141 }
142
143 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(m, &msg_len)) != 0)
144 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
145 if (msg_len > SFTP_MAX_MSG_LENGTH) {
146 do_log2(initial ? SYSLOG_LEVEL_ERROR : SYSLOG_LEVEL_FATAL,
147 "Received message too long %u", msg_len);
148 fatal("Ensure the remote shell produces no output "
149 "for non-interactive sessions.");
150 }
151
152 if ((r = sshbuf_reserve(m, msg_len, &p)) != 0)
153 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
154 if (atomicio6(read, conn->fd_in, p, msg_len, sftpio,
155 conn->limit_kbps > 0 ? &conn->bwlimit_in : NULL)
156 != msg_len) {
157 if (errno == EPIPE)
158 fatal("Connection closed");
159 else
160 fatal("Read packet: %s", strerror(errno));
161 }
162}
163
164static void
165get_msg(struct sftp_conn *conn, struct sshbuf *m)
166{
167 get_msg_extended(conn, m, 0);
168}
169
170static void
171send_string_request(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int id, u_int code, const char *s,
172 u_int len)
173{
174 struct sshbuf *msg;
175 int r;
176
177 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
178 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
179 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, code)) != 0 ||
180 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
181 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, s, len)) != 0)
182 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
183 send_msg(conn, msg);
184 debug3("Sent message fd %d T:%u I:%u", conn->fd_out, code, id);
185 sshbuf_free(msg);
186}
187
188static void
189send_string_attrs_request(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int id, u_int code,
190 const void *s, u_int len, Attrib *a)
191{
192 struct sshbuf *msg;
193 int r;
194
195 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
196 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
197 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, code)) != 0 ||
198 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
199 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, s, len)) != 0 ||
200 (r = encode_attrib(msg, a)) != 0)
201 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
202 send_msg(conn, msg);
203 debug3("Sent message fd %d T:%u I:%u", conn->fd_out, code, id);
204 sshbuf_free(msg);
205}
206
207static u_int
208get_status(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int expected_id)
209{
210 struct sshbuf *msg;
211 u_char type;
212 u_int id, status;
213 int r;
214
215 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
216 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
217 get_msg(conn, msg);
218 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
219 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
220 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
221
222 if (id != expected_id)
223 fatal("ID mismatch (%u != %u)", id, expected_id);
224 if (type != SSH2_FXP_STATUS)
225 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_STATUS(%u) packet, got %u",
226 SSH2_FXP_STATUS, type);
227
228 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
229 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
230 sshbuf_free(msg);
231
232 debug3("SSH2_FXP_STATUS %u", status);
233
234 return status;
235}
236
237static u_char *
238get_handle(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int expected_id, size_t *len,
239 const char *errfmt, ...)
240{
241 struct sshbuf *msg;
242 u_int id, status;
243 u_char type;
244 u_char *handle;
245 char errmsg[256];
246 va_list args;
247 int r;
248
249 va_start(args, errfmt);
250 if (errfmt != NULL)
251 vsnprintf(errmsg, sizeof(errmsg), errfmt, args);
252 va_end(args);
253
254 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
255 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
256 get_msg(conn, msg);
257 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
258 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
259 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
260
261 if (id != expected_id)
262 fatal("%s: ID mismatch (%u != %u)",
263 errfmt == NULL ? __func__ : errmsg, id, expected_id);
264 if (type == SSH2_FXP_STATUS) {
265 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
266 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
267 if (errfmt != NULL)
268 error("%s: %s", errmsg, fx2txt(status));
269 sshbuf_free(msg);
270 return(NULL);
271 } else if (type != SSH2_FXP_HANDLE)
272 fatal("%s: Expected SSH2_FXP_HANDLE(%u) packet, got %u",
273 errfmt == NULL ? __func__ : errmsg, SSH2_FXP_HANDLE, type);
274
275 if ((r = sshbuf_get_string(msg, &handle, len)) != 0)
276 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
277 sshbuf_free(msg);
278
279 return handle;
280}
281
282static Attrib *
283get_decode_stat(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int expected_id, int quiet)
284{
285 struct sshbuf *msg;
286 u_int id;
287 u_char type;
288 int r;
289 static Attrib a;
290
291 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
292 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
293 get_msg(conn, msg);
294
295 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
296 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
297 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
298
299 debug3("Received stat reply T:%u I:%u", type, id);
300 if (id != expected_id)
301 fatal("ID mismatch (%u != %u)", id, expected_id);
302 if (type == SSH2_FXP_STATUS) {
303 u_int status;
304
305 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
306 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
307 if (quiet)
308 debug("Couldn't stat remote file: %s", fx2txt(status));
309 else
310 error("Couldn't stat remote file: %s", fx2txt(status));
311 sshbuf_free(msg);
312 return(NULL);
313 } else if (type != SSH2_FXP_ATTRS) {
314 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_ATTRS(%u) packet, got %u",
315 SSH2_FXP_ATTRS, type);
316 }
317 if ((r = decode_attrib(msg, &a)) != 0) {
318 error("%s: couldn't decode attrib: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
319 sshbuf_free(msg);
320 return NULL;
321 }
322 sshbuf_free(msg);
323
324 return &a;
325}
326
327static int
328get_decode_statvfs(struct sftp_conn *conn, struct sftp_statvfs *st,
329 u_int expected_id, int quiet)
330{
331 struct sshbuf *msg;
332 u_char type;
333 u_int id;
334 u_int64_t flag;
335 int r;
336
337 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
338 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
339 get_msg(conn, msg);
340
341 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
342 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
343 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
344
345 debug3("Received statvfs reply T:%u I:%u", type, id);
346 if (id != expected_id)
347 fatal("ID mismatch (%u != %u)", id, expected_id);
348 if (type == SSH2_FXP_STATUS) {
349 u_int status;
350
351 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
352 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
353 if (quiet)
354 debug("Couldn't statvfs: %s", fx2txt(status));
355 else
356 error("Couldn't statvfs: %s", fx2txt(status));
357 sshbuf_free(msg);
358 return -1;
359 } else if (type != SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED_REPLY) {
360 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED_REPLY(%u) packet, got %u",
361 SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED_REPLY, type);
362 }
363
364 memset(st, 0, sizeof(*st));
365 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_bsize)) != 0 ||
366 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_frsize)) != 0 ||
367 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_blocks)) != 0 ||
368 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_bfree)) != 0 ||
369 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_bavail)) != 0 ||
370 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_files)) != 0 ||
371 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_ffree)) != 0 ||
372 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_favail)) != 0 ||
373 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_fsid)) != 0 ||
374 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &flag)) != 0 ||
375 (r = sshbuf_get_u64(msg, &st->f_namemax)) != 0)
376 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
377
378 st->f_flag = (flag & SSH2_FXE_STATVFS_ST_RDONLY) ? ST_RDONLY : 0;
379 st->f_flag |= (flag & SSH2_FXE_STATVFS_ST_NOSUID) ? ST_NOSUID : 0;
380
381 sshbuf_free(msg);
382
383 return 0;
384}
385
386struct sftp_conn *
387do_init(int fd_in, int fd_out, u_int transfer_buflen, u_int num_requests,
388 u_int64_t limit_kbps)
389{
390 u_char type;
391 struct sshbuf *msg;
392 struct sftp_conn *ret;
393 int r;
394
395 ret = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*ret));
396 ret->msg_id = 1;
397 ret->fd_in = fd_in;
398 ret->fd_out = fd_out;
399 ret->transfer_buflen = transfer_buflen;
400 ret->num_requests = num_requests;
401 ret->exts = 0;
402 ret->limit_kbps = 0;
403
404 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
405 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
406 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_INIT)) != 0 ||
407 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, SSH2_FILEXFER_VERSION)) != 0)
408 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
409 send_msg(ret, msg);
410
411 sshbuf_reset(msg);
412
413 get_msg_extended(ret, msg, 1);
414
415 /* Expecting a VERSION reply */
416 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0)
417 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
418 if (type != SSH2_FXP_VERSION) {
419 error("Invalid packet back from SSH2_FXP_INIT (type %u)",
420 type);
421 sshbuf_free(msg);
422 free(ret);
423 return(NULL);
424 }
425 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &ret->version)) != 0)
426 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
427
428 debug2("Remote version: %u", ret->version);
429
430 /* Check for extensions */
431 while (sshbuf_len(msg) > 0) {
432 char *name;
433 u_char *value;
434 size_t vlen;
435 int known = 0;
436
437 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(msg, &name, NULL)) != 0 ||
438 (r = sshbuf_get_string(msg, &value, &vlen)) != 0)
439 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
440 if (strcmp(name, "posix-rename@openssh.com") == 0 &&
441 strcmp((char *)value, "1") == 0) {
442 ret->exts |= SFTP_EXT_POSIX_RENAME;
443 known = 1;
444 } else if (strcmp(name, "statvfs@openssh.com") == 0 &&
445 strcmp((char *)value, "2") == 0) {
446 ret->exts |= SFTP_EXT_STATVFS;
447 known = 1;
448 } else if (strcmp(name, "fstatvfs@openssh.com") == 0 &&
449 strcmp((char *)value, "2") == 0) {
450 ret->exts |= SFTP_EXT_FSTATVFS;
451 known = 1;
452 } else if (strcmp(name, "hardlink@openssh.com") == 0 &&
453 strcmp((char *)value, "1") == 0) {
454 ret->exts |= SFTP_EXT_HARDLINK;
455 known = 1;
456 } else if (strcmp(name, "fsync@openssh.com") == 0 &&
457 strcmp((char *)value, "1") == 0) {
458 ret->exts |= SFTP_EXT_FSYNC;
459 known = 1;
460 } else if (strcmp(name, "lsetstat@openssh.com") == 0 &&
461 strcmp((char *)value, "1") == 0) {
462 ret->exts |= SFTP_EXT_LSETSTAT;
463 known = 1;
464 }
465 if (known) {
466 debug2("Server supports extension \"%s\" revision %s",
467 name, value);
468 } else {
469 debug2("Unrecognised server extension \"%s\"", name);
470 }
471 free(name);
472 free(value);
473 }
474
475 sshbuf_free(msg);
476
477 /* Some filexfer v.0 servers don't support large packets */
478 if (ret->version == 0)
479 ret->transfer_buflen = MINIMUM(ret->transfer_buflen, 20480);
480
481 ret->limit_kbps = limit_kbps;
482 if (ret->limit_kbps > 0) {
483 bandwidth_limit_init(&ret->bwlimit_in, ret->limit_kbps,
484 ret->transfer_buflen);
485 bandwidth_limit_init(&ret->bwlimit_out, ret->limit_kbps,
486 ret->transfer_buflen);
487 }
488
489 return ret;
490}
491
492u_int
493sftp_proto_version(struct sftp_conn *conn)
494{
495 return conn->version;
496}
497
498int
499do_close(struct sftp_conn *conn, const u_char *handle, u_int handle_len)
500{
501 u_int id, status;
502 struct sshbuf *msg;
503 int r;
504
505 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
506 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
507
508 id = conn->msg_id++;
509 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_CLOSE)) != 0 ||
510 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
511 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, handle, handle_len)) != 0)
512 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
513 send_msg(conn, msg);
514 debug3("Sent message SSH2_FXP_CLOSE I:%u", id);
515
516 status = get_status(conn, id);
517 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
518 error("Couldn't close file: %s", fx2txt(status));
519
520 sshbuf_free(msg);
521
522 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
523}
524
525
526static int
527do_lsreaddir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, int print_flag,
528 SFTP_DIRENT ***dir)
529{
530 struct sshbuf *msg;
531 u_int count, id, i, expected_id, ents = 0;
532 size_t handle_len;
533 u_char type, *handle;
534 int status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
535 int r;
536
537 if (dir)
538 *dir = NULL;
539
540 id = conn->msg_id++;
541
542 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
543 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
544 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_OPENDIR)) != 0 ||
545 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
546 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, path)) != 0)
547 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
548 send_msg(conn, msg);
549
550 handle = get_handle(conn, id, &handle_len,
551 "remote readdir(\"%s\")", path);
552 if (handle == NULL) {
553 sshbuf_free(msg);
554 return -1;
555 }
556
557 if (dir) {
558 ents = 0;
559 *dir = xcalloc(1, sizeof(**dir));
560 (*dir)[0] = NULL;
561 }
562
563 for (; !interrupted;) {
564 id = expected_id = conn->msg_id++;
565
566 debug3("Sending SSH2_FXP_READDIR I:%u", id);
567
568 sshbuf_reset(msg);
569 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_READDIR)) != 0 ||
570 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
571 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, handle, handle_len)) != 0)
572 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
573 send_msg(conn, msg);
574
575 sshbuf_reset(msg);
576
577 get_msg(conn, msg);
578
579 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
580 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
581 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
582
583 debug3("Received reply T:%u I:%u", type, id);
584
585 if (id != expected_id)
586 fatal("ID mismatch (%u != %u)", id, expected_id);
587
588 if (type == SSH2_FXP_STATUS) {
589 u_int rstatus;
590
591 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &rstatus)) != 0)
592 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
593 __func__, ssh_err(r));
594 debug3("Received SSH2_FXP_STATUS %d", rstatus);
595 if (rstatus == SSH2_FX_EOF)
596 break;
597 error("Couldn't read directory: %s", fx2txt(rstatus));
598 goto out;
599 } else if (type != SSH2_FXP_NAME)
600 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_NAME(%u) packet, got %u",
601 SSH2_FXP_NAME, type);
602
603 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &count)) != 0)
604 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
605 if (count > SSHBUF_SIZE_MAX)
606 fatal("%s: nonsensical number of entries", __func__);
607 if (count == 0)
608 break;
609 debug3("Received %d SSH2_FXP_NAME responses", count);
610 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
611 char *filename, *longname;
612 Attrib a;
613
614 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(msg, &filename,
615 NULL)) != 0 ||
616 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(msg, &longname,
617 NULL)) != 0)
618 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
619 __func__, ssh_err(r));
620 if ((r = decode_attrib(msg, &a)) != 0) {
621 error("%s: couldn't decode attrib: %s",
622 __func__, ssh_err(r));
623 free(filename);
624 free(longname);
625 sshbuf_free(msg);
626 return -1;
627 }
628
629 if (print_flag)
630 mprintf("%s\n", longname);
631
632 /*
633 * Directory entries should never contain '/'
634 * These can be used to attack recursive ops
635 * (e.g. send '../../../../etc/passwd')
636 */
637 if (strchr(filename, '/') != NULL) {
638 error("Server sent suspect path \"%s\" "
639 "during readdir of \"%s\"", filename, path);
640 } else if (dir) {
641 *dir = xreallocarray(*dir, ents + 2, sizeof(**dir));
642 (*dir)[ents] = xcalloc(1, sizeof(***dir));
643 (*dir)[ents]->filename = xstrdup(filename);
644 (*dir)[ents]->longname = xstrdup(longname);
645 memcpy(&(*dir)[ents]->a, &a, sizeof(a));
646 (*dir)[++ents] = NULL;
647 }
648 free(filename);
649 free(longname);
650 }
651 }
652 status = 0;
653
654 out:
655 sshbuf_free(msg);
656 do_close(conn, handle, handle_len);
657 free(handle);
658
659 if (status != 0 && dir != NULL) {
660 /* Don't return results on error */
661 free_sftp_dirents(*dir);
662 *dir = NULL;
663 } else if (interrupted && dir != NULL && *dir != NULL) {
664 /* Don't return partial matches on interrupt */
665 free_sftp_dirents(*dir);
666 *dir = xcalloc(1, sizeof(**dir));
667 **dir = NULL;
668 }
669
670 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
671}
672
673int
674do_readdir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, SFTP_DIRENT ***dir)
675{
676 return(do_lsreaddir(conn, path, 0, dir));
677}
678
679void free_sftp_dirents(SFTP_DIRENT **s)
680{
681 int i;
682
683 if (s == NULL)
684 return;
685 for (i = 0; s[i]; i++) {
686 free(s[i]->filename);
687 free(s[i]->longname);
688 free(s[i]);
689 }
690 free(s);
691}
692
693int
694do_rm(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path)
695{
696 u_int status, id;
697
698 debug2("Sending SSH2_FXP_REMOVE \"%s\"", path);
699
700 id = conn->msg_id++;
701 send_string_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_REMOVE, path, strlen(path));
702 status = get_status(conn, id);
703 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
704 error("Couldn't delete file: %s", fx2txt(status));
705 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
706}
707
708int
709do_mkdir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, Attrib *a, int print_flag)
710{
711 u_int status, id;
712
713 id = conn->msg_id++;
714 send_string_attrs_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_MKDIR, path,
715 strlen(path), a);
716
717 status = get_status(conn, id);
718 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK && print_flag)
719 error("Couldn't create directory: %s", fx2txt(status));
720
721 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
722}
723
724int
725do_rmdir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path)
726{
727 u_int status, id;
728
729 id = conn->msg_id++;
730 send_string_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_RMDIR, path,
731 strlen(path));
732
733 status = get_status(conn, id);
734 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
735 error("Couldn't remove directory: %s", fx2txt(status));
736
737 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
738}
739
740Attrib *
741do_stat(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, int quiet)
742{
743 u_int id;
744
745 id = conn->msg_id++;
746
747 send_string_request(conn, id,
748 conn->version == 0 ? SSH2_FXP_STAT_VERSION_0 : SSH2_FXP_STAT,
749 path, strlen(path));
750
751 return(get_decode_stat(conn, id, quiet));
752}
753
754Attrib *
755do_lstat(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, int quiet)
756{
757 u_int id;
758
759 if (conn->version == 0) {
760 if (quiet)
761 debug("Server version does not support lstat operation");
762 else
763 logit("Server version does not support lstat operation");
764 return(do_stat(conn, path, quiet));
765 }
766
767 id = conn->msg_id++;
768 send_string_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_LSTAT, path,
769 strlen(path));
770
771 return(get_decode_stat(conn, id, quiet));
772}

777 int quiet)
778{
779 u_int id;
780
781 id = conn->msg_id++;
782 send_string_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_FSTAT, handle,
783 handle_len);
784
785 return(get_decode_stat(conn, id, quiet));
786}
787#endif

789int
790do_setstat(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, Attrib *a)
791{
792 u_int status, id;
793
794 id = conn->msg_id++;
795 send_string_attrs_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_SETSTAT, path,
796 strlen(path), a);
797
798 status = get_status(conn, id);
799 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
800 error("Couldn't setstat on \"%s\": %s", path,
801 fx2txt(status));
802
803 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
804}

807do_fsetstat(struct sftp_conn *conn, const u_char *handle, u_int handle_len,

814 handle_len, a);
815
816 status = get_status(conn, id);

818 error("Couldn't fsetstat: %s", fx2txt(status));

821}
822
823char *
824do_realpath(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path)
825{
826 struct sshbuf *msg;
827 u_int expected_id, count, id;
828 char *filename, *longname;
829 Attrib a;
830 u_char type;
831 int r;
832
833 expected_id = id = conn->msg_id++;
834 send_string_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_REALPATH, path,
835 strlen(path));
836
837 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
838 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
839
840 get_msg(conn, msg);
841 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
842 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
843 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
844
845 if (id != expected_id)
846 fatal("ID mismatch (%u != %u)", id, expected_id);
847
848 if (type == SSH2_FXP_STATUS) {
849 u_int status;
850
851 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
852 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
853 error("Couldn't canonicalize: %s", fx2txt(status));
854 sshbuf_free(msg);
855 return NULL;
856 } else if (type != SSH2_FXP_NAME)
857 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_NAME(%u) packet, got %u",
858 SSH2_FXP_NAME, type);
859
860 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &count)) != 0)
861 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
862 if (count != 1)
863 fatal("Got multiple names (%d) from SSH_FXP_REALPATH", count);
864
865 if ((r = sshbuf_get_cstring(msg, &filename, NULL)) != 0 ||
866 (r = sshbuf_get_cstring(msg, &longname, NULL)) != 0 ||
867 (r = decode_attrib(msg, &a)) != 0)
868 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
869
870 debug3("SSH_FXP_REALPATH %s -> %s size %lu", path, filename,
871 (unsigned long)a.size);
872
873 free(longname);
874
875 sshbuf_free(msg);
876
877 return(filename);
878}
879
880int
881do_rename(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *oldpath, const char *newpath,
882 int force_legacy)
883{
884 struct sshbuf *msg;
885 u_int status, id;
886 int r, use_ext = (conn->exts & SFTP_EXT_POSIX_RENAME) && !force_legacy;
887
888 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
889 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
890
891 /* Send rename request */
892 id = conn->msg_id++;
893 if (use_ext) {
894 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED)) != 0 ||
895 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
896 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg,
897 "posix-rename@openssh.com")) != 0)
898 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
899 } else {
900 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_RENAME)) != 0 ||
901 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0)
902 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
903 }
904 if ((r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, oldpath)) != 0 ||
905 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, newpath)) != 0)
906 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
907 send_msg(conn, msg);
908 debug3("Sent message %s \"%s\" -> \"%s\"",
909 use_ext ? "posix-rename@openssh.com" :
910 "SSH2_FXP_RENAME", oldpath, newpath);
911 sshbuf_free(msg);
912
913 status = get_status(conn, id);
914 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
915 error("Couldn't rename file \"%s\" to \"%s\": %s", oldpath,
916 newpath, fx2txt(status));
917
918 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
919}
920
921int
922do_hardlink(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *oldpath, const char *newpath)
923{
924 struct sshbuf *msg;
925 u_int status, id;
926 int r;
927
928 if ((conn->exts & SFTP_EXT_HARDLINK) == 0) {
929 error("Server does not support hardlink@openssh.com extension");
930 return -1;
931 }
932
933 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
934 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
935
936 /* Send link request */
937 id = conn->msg_id++;
938 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED)) != 0 ||
939 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
940 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "hardlink@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
941 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, oldpath)) != 0 ||
942 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, newpath)) != 0)
943 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
944 send_msg(conn, msg);
945 debug3("Sent message hardlink@openssh.com \"%s\" -> \"%s\"",
946 oldpath, newpath);
947 sshbuf_free(msg);
948
949 status = get_status(conn, id);
950 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
951 error("Couldn't link file \"%s\" to \"%s\": %s", oldpath,
952 newpath, fx2txt(status));
953
954 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
955}
956
957int
958do_symlink(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *oldpath, const char *newpath)
959{
960 struct sshbuf *msg;
961 u_int status, id;
962 int r;
963
964 if (conn->version < 3) {
965 error("This server does not support the symlink operation");
966 return(SSH2_FX_OP_UNSUPPORTED);
967 }
968
969 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
970 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
971
972 /* Send symlink request */
973 id = conn->msg_id++;
974 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_SYMLINK)) != 0 ||
975 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
976 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, oldpath)) != 0 ||
977 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, newpath)) != 0)
978 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
979 send_msg(conn, msg);
980 debug3("Sent message SSH2_FXP_SYMLINK \"%s\" -> \"%s\"", oldpath,
981 newpath);
982 sshbuf_free(msg);
983
984 status = get_status(conn, id);
985 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
986 error("Couldn't symlink file \"%s\" to \"%s\": %s", oldpath,
987 newpath, fx2txt(status));
988
989 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
990}
991
992int
993do_fsync(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_char *handle, u_int handle_len)
994{
995 struct sshbuf *msg;
996 u_int status, id;
997 int r;
998
999 /* Silently return if the extension is not supported */
1000 if ((conn->exts & SFTP_EXT_FSYNC) == 0)
1001 return -1;
1002
1003 /* Send fsync request */
1004 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1005 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1006 id = conn->msg_id++;
1007 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED)) != 0 ||
1008 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
1009 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "fsync@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
1010 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, handle, handle_len)) != 0)
1011 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1012 send_msg(conn, msg);
1013 debug3("Sent message fsync@openssh.com I:%u", id);
1014 sshbuf_free(msg);
1015
1016 status = get_status(conn, id);
1017 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
1018 error("Couldn't sync file: %s", fx2txt(status));
1019
1020 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
1021}
1022

1025do_readlink(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path)
1026{
1027 struct sshbuf *msg;
1028 u_int expected_id, count, id;
1029 char *filename, *longname;
1030 Attrib a;
1031 u_char type;
1032 int r;
1033
1034 expected_id = id = conn->msg_id++;
1035 send_string_request(conn, id, SSH2_FXP_READLINK, path, strlen(path));
1036
1037 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1038 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1039
1040 get_msg(conn, msg);
1041 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
1042 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
1043 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1044
1045 if (id != expected_id)
1046 fatal("ID mismatch (%u != %u)", id, expected_id);
1047

1054 sshbuf_free(msg);
1055 return(NULL);
1056 } else if (type != SSH2_FXP_NAME)
1057 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_NAME(%u) packet, got %u",
1058 SSH2_FXP_NAME, type);

1069

1071

1073
1074 sshbuf_free(msg);
1075
1076 return filename;
1077}

1080int
1081do_statvfs(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, struct sftp_statvfs *st,
1082 int quiet)
1083{
1084 struct sshbuf *msg;
1085 u_int id;
1086 int r;
1087
1088 if ((conn->exts & SFTP_EXT_STATVFS) == 0) {
1089 error("Server does not support statvfs@openssh.com extension");
1090 return -1;
1091 }
1092
1093 id = conn->msg_id++;
1094
1095 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1096 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1097 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED)) != 0 ||
1098 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
1099 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "statvfs@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
1100 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, path)) != 0)
1101 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1102 send_msg(conn, msg);
1103 sshbuf_free(msg);
1104
1105 return get_decode_statvfs(conn, st, id, quiet);
1106}

1137int
1138do_lsetstat(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *path, Attrib *a)
1139{
1140 struct sshbuf *msg;
1141 u_int status, id;
1142 int r;
1143
1144 if ((conn->exts & SFTP_EXT_LSETSTAT) == 0) {
1145 error("Server does not support lsetstat@openssh.com extension");
1146 return -1;
1147 }
1148
1149 id = conn->msg_id++;
1150 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1151 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1152 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_EXTENDED)) != 0 ||
1153 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
1154 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, "lsetstat@openssh.com")) != 0 ||
1155 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, path)) != 0 ||
1156 (r = encode_attrib(msg, a)) != 0)
1157 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1158 send_msg(conn, msg);
1159 sshbuf_free(msg);
1160
1161 status = get_status(conn, id);
1162 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK)
1163 error("Couldn't setstat on \"%s\": %s", path,
1164 fx2txt(status));
1165
1166 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
1167}
1168
1169static void
1170send_read_request(struct sftp_conn *conn, u_int id, u_int64_t offset,
1171 u_int len, const u_char *handle, u_int handle_len)
1172{
1173 struct sshbuf *msg;
1174 int r;
1175
1176 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1177 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1178 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_READ)) != 0 ||
1179 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
1180 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, handle, handle_len)) != 0 ||
1181 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, offset)) != 0 ||
1182 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, len)) != 0)
1183 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1184 send_msg(conn, msg);
1185 sshbuf_free(msg);
1186}
1187
1188int
1189do_download(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *remote_path,
1190 const char *local_path, Attrib *a, int preserve_flag, int resume_flag,
1191 int fsync_flag)
1192{
1193 Attrib junk;
1194 struct sshbuf *msg;
1195 u_char *handle;
1196 int local_fd = -1, write_error;
1197 int read_error, write_errno, reordered = 0, r;
1198 u_int64_t offset = 0, size, highwater;
1199 u_int mode, id, buflen, num_req, max_req, status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1200 off_t progress_counter;
1201 size_t handle_len;
1202 struct stat st;
1203 struct request {
1204 u_int id;
1205 size_t len;
1206 u_int64_t offset;
1207 TAILQ_ENTRY(request) tq;
1208 };
1209 TAILQ_HEAD(reqhead, request) requests;
1210 struct request *req;
1211 u_char type;
1212
1213 status = -1;
1214 TAILQ_INIT(&requests);
1215
1216 if (a == NULL && (a = do_stat(conn, remote_path, 0)) == NULL)
1217 return -1;
1218
1219 /* Do not preserve set[ug]id here, as we do not preserve ownership */
1220 if (a->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS)
1221 mode = a->perm & 0777;
1222 else
1223 mode = 0666;
1224
1225 if ((a->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS) &&
1226 (!S_ISREG(a->perm))) {
1227 error("Cannot download non-regular file: %s", remote_path);
1228 return(-1);
1229 }
1230
1231 if (a->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE)
1232 size = a->size;
1233 else
1234 size = 0;
1235
1236 buflen = conn->transfer_buflen;
1237 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1238 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1239
1240 attrib_clear(&junk); /* Send empty attributes */
1241
1242 /* Send open request */
1243 id = conn->msg_id++;
1244 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_OPEN)) != 0 ||
1245 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
1246 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, remote_path)) != 0 ||
1247 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, SSH2_FXF_READ)) != 0 ||
1248 (r = encode_attrib(msg, &junk)) != 0)
1249 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1250 send_msg(conn, msg);
1251 debug3("Sent message SSH2_FXP_OPEN I:%u P:%s", id, remote_path);
1252
1253 handle = get_handle(conn, id, &handle_len,
1254 "remote open(\"%s\")", remote_path);
1255 if (handle == NULL) {
1256 sshbuf_free(msg);
1257 return(-1);
1258 }
1259
1260 local_fd = open(local_path,
1261 O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | (resume_flag ? 0 : O_TRUNC), mode | S_IWUSR);
1262 if (local_fd == -1) {
1263 error("Couldn't open local file \"%s\" for writing: %s",
1264 local_path, strerror(errno));
1265 goto fail;
1266 }
1267 offset = highwater = 0;
1268 if (resume_flag) {
1269 if (fstat(local_fd, &st) == -1) {
1270 error("Unable to stat local file \"%s\": %s",
1271 local_path, strerror(errno));
1272 goto fail;
1273 }
1274 if (st.st_size < 0) {
1275 error("\"%s\" has negative size", local_path);
1276 goto fail;
1277 }
1278 if ((u_int64_t)st.st_size > size) {
1279 error("Unable to resume download of \"%s\": "
1280 "local file is larger than remote", local_path);
1281 fail:
1282 do_close(conn, handle, handle_len);
1283 sshbuf_free(msg);
1284 free(handle);
1285 if (local_fd != -1)
1286 close(local_fd);
1287 return -1;
1288 }
1289 offset = highwater = st.st_size;
1290 }
1291
1292 /* Read from remote and write to local */
1293 write_error = read_error = write_errno = num_req = 0;
1294 max_req = 1;
1295 progress_counter = offset;
1296
1297 if (showprogress && size != 0)
1298 start_progress_meter(remote_path, size, &progress_counter);
1299
1300 while (num_req > 0 || max_req > 0) {
1301 u_char *data;
1302 size_t len;
1303
1304 /*
1305 * Simulate EOF on interrupt: stop sending new requests and
1306 * allow outstanding requests to drain gracefully
1307 */
1308 if (interrupted) {
1309 if (num_req == 0) /* If we haven't started yet... */
1310 break;
1311 max_req = 0;
1312 }
1313
1314 /* Send some more requests */
1315 while (num_req < max_req) {
1316 debug3("Request range %llu -> %llu (%d/%d)",
1317 (unsigned long long)offset,
1318 (unsigned long long)offset + buflen - 1,
1319 num_req, max_req);
1320 req = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*req));
1321 req->id = conn->msg_id++;
1322 req->len = buflen;
1323 req->offset = offset;
1324 offset += buflen;
1325 num_req++;
1326 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&requests, req, tq);
1327 send_read_request(conn, req->id, req->offset,
1328 req->len, handle, handle_len);
1329 }
1330
1331 sshbuf_reset(msg);
1332 get_msg(conn, msg);
1333 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
1334 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &id)) != 0)
1335 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1336 debug3("Received reply T:%u I:%u R:%d", type, id, max_req);
1337
1338 /* Find the request in our queue */
1339 for (req = TAILQ_FIRST(&requests);
1340 req != NULL && req->id != id;
1341 req = TAILQ_NEXT(req, tq))
1342 ;
1343 if (req == NULL)
1344 fatal("Unexpected reply %u", id);
1345
1346 switch (type) {
1347 case SSH2_FXP_STATUS:
1348 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
1349 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1350 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1351 if (status != SSH2_FX_EOF)
1352 read_error = 1;
1353 max_req = 0;
1354 TAILQ_REMOVE(&requests, req, tq);
1355 free(req);
1356 num_req--;
1357 break;
1358 case SSH2_FXP_DATA:
1359 if ((r = sshbuf_get_string(msg, &data, &len)) != 0)
1360 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1361 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1362 debug3("Received data %llu -> %llu",
1363 (unsigned long long)req->offset,
1364 (unsigned long long)req->offset + len - 1);
1365 if (len > req->len)
1366 fatal("Received more data than asked for "
1367 "%zu > %zu", len, req->len);
1368 if ((lseek(local_fd, req->offset, SEEK_SET) == -1 ||
1369 atomicio(vwrite, local_fd, data, len) != len) &&
1370 !write_error) {
1371 write_errno = errno;
1372 write_error = 1;
1373 max_req = 0;
1374 }
1375 else if (!reordered && req->offset <= highwater)
1376 highwater = req->offset + len;
1377 else if (!reordered && req->offset > highwater)
1378 reordered = 1;
1379 progress_counter += len;
1380 free(data);
1381
1382 if (len == req->len) {
1383 TAILQ_REMOVE(&requests, req, tq);
1384 free(req);
1385 num_req--;
1386 } else {
1387 /* Resend the request for the missing data */
1388 debug3("Short data block, re-requesting "
1389 "%llu -> %llu (%2d)",
1390 (unsigned long long)req->offset + len,
1391 (unsigned long long)req->offset +
1392 req->len - 1, num_req);
1393 req->id = conn->msg_id++;
1394 req->len -= len;
1395 req->offset += len;
1396 send_read_request(conn, req->id,
1397 req->offset, req->len, handle, handle_len);
1398 /* Reduce the request size */
1399 if (len < buflen)
1400 buflen = MAXIMUM(MIN_READ_SIZE, len);
1401 }
1402 if (max_req > 0) { /* max_req = 0 iff EOF received */
1403 if (size > 0 && offset > size) {
1404 /* Only one request at a time
1405 * after the expected EOF */
1406 debug3("Finish at %llu (%2d)",
1407 (unsigned long long)offset,
1408 num_req);
1409 max_req = 1;
1410 } else if (max_req <= conn->num_requests) {
1411 ++max_req;
1412 }
1413 }
1414 break;
1415 default:
1416 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_DATA(%u) packet, got %u",
1417 SSH2_FXP_DATA, type);
1418 }
1419 }
1420
1421 if (showprogress && size)
1422 stop_progress_meter();
1423
1424 /* Sanity check */
1425 if (TAILQ_FIRST(&requests) != NULL)
1426 fatal("Transfer complete, but requests still in queue");
1427 /* Truncate at highest contiguous point to avoid holes on interrupt */
1428 if (read_error || write_error || interrupted) {
1429 if (reordered && resume_flag) {
1430 error("Unable to resume download of \"%s\": "
1431 "server reordered requests", local_path);
1432 }
1433 debug("truncating at %llu", (unsigned long long)highwater);
1434 if (ftruncate(local_fd, highwater) == -1)
1435 error("ftruncate \"%s\": %s", local_path,
1436 strerror(errno));
1437 }
1438 if (read_error) {
1439 error("Couldn't read from remote file \"%s\" : %s",
1440 remote_path, fx2txt(status));
1441 status = -1;
1442 do_close(conn, handle, handle_len);
1443 } else if (write_error) {
1444 error("Couldn't write to \"%s\": %s", local_path,
1445 strerror(write_errno));
1446 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1447 do_close(conn, handle, handle_len);
1448 } else {
1449 if (do_close(conn, handle, handle_len) != 0 || interrupted)
1450 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1451 else
1452 status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1453 /* Override umask and utimes if asked */
1454 if (preserve_flag && fchmod(local_fd, mode) == -1)
1455 error("Couldn't set mode on \"%s\": %s", local_path,
1456 strerror(errno));
1457 if (preserve_flag &&
1458 (a->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME)) {
1459 struct timeval tv[2];
1460 tv[0].tv_sec = a->atime;
1461 tv[1].tv_sec = a->mtime;
1462 tv[0].tv_usec = tv[1].tv_usec = 0;
1463 if (utimes(local_path, tv) == -1)
1464 error("Can't set times on \"%s\": %s",
1465 local_path, strerror(errno));
1466 }
1467 if (fsync_flag) {
1468 debug("syncing \"%s\"", local_path);
1469 if (fsync(local_fd) == -1)
1470 error("Couldn't sync file \"%s\": %s",
1471 local_path, strerror(errno));
1472 }
1473 }
1474 close(local_fd);
1475 sshbuf_free(msg);
1476 free(handle);
1477
1478 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
1479}
1480
1481static int
1482download_dir_internal(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *src, const char *dst,
1483 int depth, Attrib *dirattrib, int preserve_flag, int print_flag,
1484 int resume_flag, int fsync_flag)
1485{
1486 int i, ret = 0;
1487 SFTP_DIRENT **dir_entries;
1488 char *filename, *new_src = NULL, *new_dst = NULL;
1489 mode_t mode = 0777;
1490
1491 if (depth >= MAX_DIR_DEPTH) {
1492 error("Maximum directory depth exceeded: %d levels", depth);
1493 return -1;
1494 }
1495
1496 if (dirattrib == NULL &&
1497 (dirattrib = do_stat(conn, src, 1)) == NULL) {
1498 error("Unable to stat remote directory \"%s\"", src);
1499 return -1;
1500 }
1501 if (!S_ISDIR(dirattrib->perm)) {
1502 error("\"%s\" is not a directory", src);
1503 return -1;
1504 }
1505 if (print_flag)
1506 mprintf("Retrieving %s\n", src);
1507
1508 if (dirattrib->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS)
1509 mode = dirattrib->perm & 01777;
1510 else {
1511 debug("Server did not send permissions for "
1512 "directory \"%s\"", dst);
1513 }
1514
1515 if (mkdir(dst, mode) == -1 && errno != EEXIST) {
1516 error("mkdir %s: %s", dst, strerror(errno));
1517 return -1;
1518 }
1519
1520 if (do_readdir(conn, src, &dir_entries) == -1) {
1521 error("%s: Failed to get directory contents", src);
1522 return -1;
1523 }
1524
1525 for (i = 0; dir_entries[i] != NULL && !interrupted; i++) {
1526 free(new_dst);
1527 free(new_src);
1528
1529 filename = dir_entries[i]->filename;
1530 new_dst = path_append(dst, filename);
1531 new_src = path_append(src, filename);
1532
1533 if (S_ISDIR(dir_entries[i]->a.perm)) {
1534 if (strcmp(filename, ".") == 0 ||
1535 strcmp(filename, "..") == 0)
1536 continue;
1537 if (download_dir_internal(conn, new_src, new_dst,
1538 depth + 1, &(dir_entries[i]->a), preserve_flag,
1539 print_flag, resume_flag, fsync_flag) == -1)
1540 ret = -1;
1541 } else if (S_ISREG(dir_entries[i]->a.perm) ) {
1542 if (do_download(conn, new_src, new_dst,
1543 &(dir_entries[i]->a), preserve_flag,
1544 resume_flag, fsync_flag) == -1) {
1545 error("Download of file %s to %s failed",
1546 new_src, new_dst);
1547 ret = -1;
1548 }
1549 } else
1550 logit("%s: not a regular file\n", new_src);
1551
1552 }
1553 free(new_dst);
1554 free(new_src);
1555
1556 if (preserve_flag) {
1557 if (dirattrib->flags & SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME) {
1558 struct timeval tv[2];
1559 tv[0].tv_sec = dirattrib->atime;
1560 tv[1].tv_sec = dirattrib->mtime;
1561 tv[0].tv_usec = tv[1].tv_usec = 0;
1562 if (utimes(dst, tv) == -1)
1563 error("Can't set times on \"%s\": %s",
1564 dst, strerror(errno));
1565 } else
1566 debug("Server did not send times for directory "
1567 "\"%s\"", dst);
1568 }
1569
1570 free_sftp_dirents(dir_entries);
1571
1572 return ret;
1573}
1574
1575int
1576download_dir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *src, const char *dst,
1577 Attrib *dirattrib, int preserve_flag, int print_flag, int resume_flag,
1578 int fsync_flag)
1579{
1580 char *src_canon;
1581 int ret;
1582
1583 if ((src_canon = do_realpath(conn, src)) == NULL) {
1584 error("Unable to canonicalize path \"%s\"", src);
1585 return -1;
1586 }
1587
1588 ret = download_dir_internal(conn, src_canon, dst, 0,
1589 dirattrib, preserve_flag, print_flag, resume_flag, fsync_flag);
1590 free(src_canon);
1591 return ret;
1592}
1593
1594int
1595do_upload(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *local_path,
1596 const char *remote_path, int preserve_flag, int resume, int fsync_flag)
1597{
1598 int r, local_fd;
1599 u_int status = SSH2_FX_OK;
1600 u_int id;
1601 u_char type;
1602 off_t offset, progress_counter;
1603 u_char *handle, *data;
1604 struct sshbuf *msg;
1605 struct stat sb;
1606 Attrib a, *c = NULL;
1607 u_int32_t startid;
1608 u_int32_t ackid;
1609 struct outstanding_ack {
1610 u_int id;
1611 u_int len;
1612 off_t offset;
1613 TAILQ_ENTRY(outstanding_ack) tq;
1614 };
1615 TAILQ_HEAD(ackhead, outstanding_ack) acks;
1616 struct outstanding_ack *ack = NULL;
1617 size_t handle_len;
1618
1619 TAILQ_INIT(&acks);
1620
1621 if ((local_fd = open(local_path, O_RDONLY, 0)) == -1) {
1622 error("Couldn't open local file \"%s\" for reading: %s",
1623 local_path, strerror(errno));
1624 return(-1);
1625 }
1626 if (fstat(local_fd, &sb) == -1) {
1627 error("Couldn't fstat local file \"%s\": %s",
1628 local_path, strerror(errno));
1629 close(local_fd);
1630 return(-1);
1631 }
1632 if (!S_ISREG(sb.st_mode)) {
1633 error("%s is not a regular file", local_path);
1634 close(local_fd);
1635 return(-1);
1636 }
1637 stat_to_attrib(&sb, &a);
1638
1639 a.flags &= ~SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE;
1640 a.flags &= ~SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID;
1641 a.perm &= 0777;
1642 if (!preserve_flag)
1643 a.flags &= ~SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME;
1644
1645 if (resume) {
1646 /* Get remote file size if it exists */
1647 if ((c = do_stat(conn, remote_path, 0)) == NULL) {
1648 close(local_fd);
1649 return -1;
1650 }
1651
1652 if ((off_t)c->size >= sb.st_size) {
1653 error("destination file bigger or same size as "
1654 "source file");
1655 close(local_fd);
1656 return -1;
1657 }
1658
1659 if (lseek(local_fd, (off_t)c->size, SEEK_SET) == -1) {
1660 close(local_fd);
1661 return -1;
1662 }
1663 }
1664
1665 if ((msg = sshbuf_new()) == NULL)
1666 fatal("%s: sshbuf_new failed", __func__);
1667
1668 /* Send open request */
1669 id = conn->msg_id++;
1670 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_OPEN)) != 0 ||
1671 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, id)) != 0 ||
1672 (r = sshbuf_put_cstring(msg, remote_path)) != 0 ||
1673 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, SSH2_FXF_WRITE|SSH2_FXF_CREAT|
1674 (resume ? SSH2_FXF_APPEND : SSH2_FXF_TRUNC))) != 0 ||
1675 (r = encode_attrib(msg, &a)) != 0)
1676 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s", __func__, ssh_err(r));
1677 send_msg(conn, msg);
1678 debug3("Sent message SSH2_FXP_OPEN I:%u P:%s", id, remote_path);
1679
1680 sshbuf_reset(msg);
1681
1682 handle = get_handle(conn, id, &handle_len,
1683 "remote open(\"%s\")", remote_path);
1684 if (handle == NULL) {
1685 close(local_fd);
1686 sshbuf_free(msg);
1687 return -1;
1688 }
1689
1690 startid = ackid = id + 1;
1691 data = xmalloc(conn->transfer_buflen);
1692
1693 /* Read from local and write to remote */
1694 offset = progress_counter = (resume ? c->size : 0);
1695 if (showprogress)
1696 start_progress_meter(local_path, sb.st_size,
1697 &progress_counter);
1698
1699 for (;;) {
1700 int len;
1701
1702 /*
1703 * Can't use atomicio here because it returns 0 on EOF,
1704 * thus losing the last block of the file.
1705 * Simulate an EOF on interrupt, allowing ACKs from the
1706 * server to drain.
1707 */
1708 if (interrupted || status != SSH2_FX_OK)
1709 len = 0;
1710 else do
1711 len = read(local_fd, data, conn->transfer_buflen);
1712 while ((len == -1) && (errno == EINTR || errno == EAGAIN));
1713
1714 if (len == -1)
1715 fatal("Couldn't read from \"%s\": %s", local_path,
1716 strerror(errno));
1717
1718 if (len != 0) {
1719 ack = xcalloc(1, sizeof(*ack));
1720 ack->id = ++id;
1721 ack->offset = offset;
1722 ack->len = len;
1723 TAILQ_INSERT_TAIL(&acks, ack, tq);
1724
1725 sshbuf_reset(msg);
1726 if ((r = sshbuf_put_u8(msg, SSH2_FXP_WRITE)) != 0 ||
1727 (r = sshbuf_put_u32(msg, ack->id)) != 0 ||
1728 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, handle,
1729 handle_len)) != 0 ||
1730 (r = sshbuf_put_u64(msg, offset)) != 0 ||
1731 (r = sshbuf_put_string(msg, data, len)) != 0)
1732 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1733 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1734 send_msg(conn, msg);
1735 debug3("Sent message SSH2_FXP_WRITE I:%u O:%llu S:%u",
1736 id, (unsigned long long)offset, len);
1737 } else if (TAILQ_FIRST(&acks) == NULL)
1738 break;
1739
1740 if (ack == NULL)
1741 fatal("Unexpected ACK %u", id);
1742
1743 if (id == startid || len == 0 ||
1744 id - ackid >= conn->num_requests) {
1745 u_int rid;
1746
1747 sshbuf_reset(msg);
1748 get_msg(conn, msg);
1749 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u8(msg, &type)) != 0 ||
1750 (r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &rid)) != 0)
1751 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1752 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1753
1754 if (type != SSH2_FXP_STATUS)
1755 fatal("Expected SSH2_FXP_STATUS(%d) packet, "
1756 "got %d", SSH2_FXP_STATUS, type);
1757
1758 if ((r = sshbuf_get_u32(msg, &status)) != 0)
1759 fatal("%s: buffer error: %s",
1760 __func__, ssh_err(r));
1761 debug3("SSH2_FXP_STATUS %u", status);
1762
1763 /* Find the request in our queue */
1764 for (ack = TAILQ_FIRST(&acks);
1765 ack != NULL && ack->id != rid;
1766 ack = TAILQ_NEXT(ack, tq))
1767 ;
1768 if (ack == NULL)
1769 fatal("Can't find request for ID %u", rid);
1770 TAILQ_REMOVE(&acks, ack, tq);
1771 debug3("In write loop, ack for %u %u bytes at %lld",
1772 ack->id, ack->len, (long long)ack->offset);
1773 ++ackid;
1774 progress_counter += ack->len;
1775 free(ack);
1776 }
1777 offset += len;
1778 if (offset < 0)
1779 fatal("%s: offset < 0", __func__);
1780 }
1781 sshbuf_free(msg);
1782
1783 if (showprogress)
1784 stop_progress_meter();
1785 free(data);
1786
1787 if (status != SSH2_FX_OK) {
1788 error("Couldn't write to remote file \"%s\": %s",
1789 remote_path, fx2txt(status));
1790 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1791 }
1792
1793 if (close(local_fd) == -1) {
1794 error("Couldn't close local file \"%s\": %s", local_path,
1795 strerror(errno));
1796 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1797 }
1798
1799 /* Override umask and utimes if asked */
1800 if (preserve_flag)
1801 do_fsetstat(conn, handle, handle_len, &a);
1802
1803 if (fsync_flag)
1804 (void)do_fsync(conn, handle, handle_len);
1805
1806 if (do_close(conn, handle, handle_len) != 0)
1807 status = SSH2_FX_FAILURE;
1808
1809 free(handle);
1810
1811 return status == SSH2_FX_OK ? 0 : -1;
1812}
1813
1814static int
1815upload_dir_internal(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *src, const char *dst,
1816 int depth, int preserve_flag, int print_flag, int resume, int fsync_flag)
1817{
1818 int ret = 0;
1819 DIR *dirp;
1820 struct dirent *dp;
1821 char *filename, *new_src = NULL, *new_dst = NULL;
1822 struct stat sb;
1823 Attrib a, *dirattrib;
1824
1825 if (depth >= MAX_DIR_DEPTH) {
1826 error("Maximum directory depth exceeded: %d levels", depth);
1827 return -1;
1828 }
1829
1830 if (stat(src, &sb) == -1) {
1831 error("Couldn't stat directory \"%s\": %s",
1832 src, strerror(errno));
1833 return -1;
1834 }
1835 if (!S_ISDIR(sb.st_mode)) {
1836 error("\"%s\" is not a directory", src);
1837 return -1;
1838 }
1839 if (print_flag)
1840 mprintf("Entering %s\n", src);
1841
1842 attrib_clear(&a);
1843 stat_to_attrib(&sb, &a);
1844 a.flags &= ~SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE;
1845 a.flags &= ~SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID;
1846 a.perm &= 01777;
1847 if (!preserve_flag)
1848 a.flags &= ~SSH2_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME;
1849
1850 /*
1851 * sftp lacks a portable status value to match errno EEXIST,
1852 * so if we get a failure back then we must check whether
1853 * the path already existed and is a directory.
1854 */
1855 if (do_mkdir(conn, dst, &a, 0) != 0) {
1856 if ((dirattrib = do_stat(conn, dst, 0)) == NULL)
1857 return -1;
1858 if (!S_ISDIR(dirattrib->perm)) {
1859 error("\"%s\" exists but is not a directory", dst);
1860 return -1;
1861 }
1862 }
1863
1864 if ((dirp = opendir(src)) == NULL) {
1865 error("Failed to open dir \"%s\": %s", src, strerror(errno));
1866 return -1;
1867 }
1868
1869 while (((dp = readdir(dirp)) != NULL) && !interrupted) {
1870 if (dp->d_ino == 0)
1871 continue;
1872 free(new_dst);
1873 free(new_src);
1874 filename = dp->d_name;
1875 new_dst = path_append(dst, filename);
1876 new_src = path_append(src, filename);
1877
1878 if (lstat(new_src, &sb) == -1) {
1879 logit("%s: lstat failed: %s", filename,
1880 strerror(errno));
1881 ret = -1;
1882 } else if (S_ISDIR(sb.st_mode)) {
1883 if (strcmp(filename, ".") == 0 ||
1884 strcmp(filename, "..") == 0)
1885 continue;
1886
1887 if (upload_dir_internal(conn, new_src, new_dst,
1888 depth + 1, preserve_flag, print_flag, resume,
1889 fsync_flag) == -1)
1890 ret = -1;
1891 } else if (S_ISREG(sb.st_mode)) {
1892 if (do_upload(conn, new_src, new_dst,
1893 preserve_flag, resume, fsync_flag) == -1) {
1894 error("Uploading of file %s to %s failed!",
1895 new_src, new_dst);
1896 ret = -1;
1897 }
1898 } else
1899 logit("%s: not a regular file\n", filename);
1900 }
1901 free(new_dst);
1902 free(new_src);
1903
1904 do_setstat(conn, dst, &a);
1905
1906 (void) closedir(dirp);
1907 return ret;
1908}
1909
1910int
1911upload_dir(struct sftp_conn *conn, const char *src, const char *dst,
1912 int preserve_flag, int print_flag, int resume, int fsync_flag)
1913{
1914 char *dst_canon;
1915 int ret;
1916
1917 if ((dst_canon = do_realpath(conn, dst)) == NULL) {
1918 error("Unable to canonicalize path \"%s\"", dst);
1919 return -1;
1920 }
1921
1922 ret = upload_dir_internal(conn, src, dst_canon, 0, preserve_flag,
1923 print_flag, resume, fsync_flag);
1924
1925 free(dst_canon);
1926 return ret;
1927}
1928
1929char *
1930path_append(const char *p1, const char *p2)
1931{
1932 char *ret;
1933 size_t len = strlen(p1) + strlen(p2) + 2;
1934
1935 ret = xmalloc(len);
1936 strlcpy(ret, p1, len);
1937 if (p1[0] != '\0' && p1[strlen(p1) - 1] != '/')
1938 strlcat(ret, "/", len);
1939 strlcat(ret, p2, len);
1940
1941 return(ret);
1942}
1943
